intro: Aldama gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's Aldama, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aldama gentryi is considered a rare and endangered species.
